q: to make room for co-founder Larry Page. Eric Schmidt will move into an Executive Chairman role. But why? And what does it mean for you? According to Eric Schmidt : Larry will now lead product development and technology strategy, his greatest strengths, and starting from April 4 he will take charge of our day-to-day operations as Google's Chief Executive Officer. In this new role I know he will merge Google's technology and business vision brilliantly. The third leg of the triumvirate, Sergey Brin , will take the title of Co-Founder, focusing on new products. , as I know as a former Apple board member- you have to use their development tools, their platform, their software, their hardware,'' Eric Schmidt said at a conference this fall. If you submit an application, they have to approve it. You have to use their monetization and their distribution. That would not be open. The inverse would be open. But Vic Gundotra is the one senior Googler who has been pointedly critical of Steve Jobs and Apple- at least in public. Last May, at Google's annual developer conference, Vic Gundotra told the world

Andy Coulson denies being aware of any wrongdoing at the paper, part of Rupert Murdoch 's News Corp media group, and police said last month there was not enough evidence to charge him with any crime. Obviously when he was editor of the News of the World, bad things happened at that newspaper and when he found about those, he resigned. That was the right thing to do, David Cameron told BBC Radio 4's Today program.`` I gave him a second chance,'' David Cameron added.`` I think he has done a good job for the government and for the country.

It was meant to point out that there was broad support in Eastern Europe and that France and Germany did not speak for the entire continent. Ironically, my comment was unintentional, Donald Rumsfeld writes.`` I had meant to say France and Germany represented` old NATO' not` old Europe'.''`` In any event, the phrase` old Europe' entered the vernacular.
